lead_paragraph: Darrell Kestner, who missed the cut last year, yesterday won the rain-shortened Long Island Golf Association Open championship at the Bethpage State Park Red Course. Kestner parred the final hole for a 75 and a 36-hole total of 142. Ron Faria bogeyed the last hole for a 74 and fell into a three-way tie for second at 143 with Abbie Valentine (73) and Jim Hazen (70).
